    • Field Detail

      • cc

        private final double cc

      • cSigma

        private final double cSigma
        C_sigma.

      • c1

        private final double c1

      • cmu

        private final double cmu

      • dampSigma

        private final double dampSigma
        Damping for sigma.

      • pc

        private RichArray pc
        P_c of sigma. Evolution paths for C and sigma

      • pSigma

        private RichArray pSigma
        P of sigma. Used for step size control.

      • sigma

        private double sigma
        Step size in CMA-ES. It stores the standard deviation of all objective variables.

      • B

        private RichMatrix B
        B defines the coordinate system. B is an orthogonal matrix. Columns of B are eigenvectors of C with unit length and correspond to the diagonal elements of D.

      • C

        private RichMatrix C
        Covariance matrix C. Covariance matrix at generation g.

      • D

        private RichArray D
        D contains the standard deviations. Diagonal D defines the scaling. A diagonal matrix (thus, represented with an array). The diagonal elements of D are square roots of eigenvalues of C and correspond to the respective columns of B.

      • eigeneval

        private double eigeneval
        Track update of B and D.

      • invsqrtC

        private RichMatrix invsqrtC
        C^-1/2

      • chiN

        private final double chiN
        Expectation of ||N(0,I)|| == norm(randn(N,1)).

      • dimensions

        private final int dimensions
        Number of objective variables/problem dimension.

      • xMean

        private RichArray xMean
        Mean of objective variables. Recombination, new mean value in CMA-ES.

      • mu

        private final int mu
        Number of parents for recombination in CMA-ES.

      • muEffective

        private final double muEffective
        Variance effective selection mass. It holds 1 <= muEffective <= mu

      • weights

        private RichArray weights
        Array for weighted recombination in CMA-ES. Positive weight coefficients for recombination.

      • counteval

        private int counteval
        Counter for the number of evaluations. A good optimisation method will minimise this number.

      • errorsNumber

        private final int errorsNumber

    • Constructor Detail

        public DifferentialRecombination(int populationSize,
                                 int dimensions)
        Parameters:
        populationSize - Number of individuals of the population
        dimensions - Number of different genes

      • recombinate

        public Population recombinate(Population population,
                              IndividualGroup[] groups)
        Creates a new offspring population. The new population size has to be equal to the original population size.
        Specified by:
        recombinate in interface IRecombination
        Parameters:
        population - original population. For the moment only used to get the fitness errors
        groups - new individuals
        Returns:
        new Population

      • isDtooLarge

        public boolean isDtooLarge()
        Condition exceeds 1e14
        Specified by:
        isDtooLarge in interface IRecombination
        Returns:
        true if D > 1e14
